reasoning: Thyrotroph adenomas (TSH-secreting adenomas) comprise approximately 1-2% of all pituitary adenomas. With overall pituitary adenoma incidence of ~5 per 100k, thyrotroph adenomas represent approximately 0.05-0.1 per 100k incidence. Prevalence estimated at 1 per 100k based on pituitary tumor registries.
source: Ezzat S et al. (2004). The epidemiology of pituitary adenomas in Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 89(5):2124-2129
